Pre-Game Insights: Benin and Libya clash at the Felix Houphouet Boigny Stadium in neutral Ivory Coast on Tuesday in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers.
Neither side won their first game of the round in Group D.
Benin are ranked 91st in the world and are looking to reach the AFCON showpiece next year for their fifth appearance in history, and a first since 2019.
Libya were pegged back by Rwanda in a 1-1 stalemate in their first game of the round.
The Mediterranean Knights have beaten their West African opponents in their most recent two encounters: 3-2 in February 2011 and 1-0 in November 2013 (both friendlies).
The sides are clashing for the first time in almost 11 years.
The Cheetahs are ranked 91st in the world. Their rivals from North Africa are 26 places adrift.
In nine official clashes this year, the Libyans have lost just once while winning six.
Since 2023, the Cheetahs have played 10 games, winning just twice and losing five times.
The Mediterranean Knights have seen a better run than their rivals, who've been going through a rough patch since last year.
Back-to-back wins over Rwanda and Nigeria in the World Cup qualifiers signaled a possible return to form, but the Super Eagles crushed them last week to lay bare their vulnerabilities.
